## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm trying to launch a currency and I'm a bit stuck. Can you explain why you need to fund the currency with 100 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, you need to fund the currency with at least 10 VRSCTEST, not 100, before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch. Additionally, the currency launch requires 1000 VRSCTEST to be preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch. Does that clear things up for you?

**User:**
That makes sense, thanks! I've got another question, though. What happens if you send the command to convert VRSCTEST to GOLD before the GOLD token launches?

**AI Assistant:**
If you send the command to convert VRSCTEST to GOLD before the GOLD token launches, the conversion will be parked until the token launches. Once the GOLD token launches, you will either find 0.975 GOLD in your wallet, or you will have your VRSCTEST back. So, don't worry, your funds will be safely handled until the launch is complete. Do you have any other questions about launching a currency or working with Verus?
Can you explain why you need to fund the currency with 100 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch?

You actually need to fund the currency with at least 10 VRSCTEST, not 100, before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch. Additionally, the currency launch requires 1000 VRSCTEST to be preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch.

ncy must be funded with at least 10 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction returned from this command to
initiate a currency launch that will start at 50 blocks from when it was made (default), and that must have 1000 VRSCTEST preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch.
all of this happens as part of the mining process, since mining the blocks that launch a currency earn the 0.025% conversion fees of participation
in the launch, converting VRSCTEST to GOLD. I could send the following command before the block where GOLD token launches.
After it launches, the only way at present to create new tokens is with a centralized issuance option. To convert VRSCTEST to GOLD, you could issue the command:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
that would effectively park my conversion until the token launches, at which point, I will either find 0.975 GOLD in my wallet, or I will have my VRSCTEST back.
Assuming it launches, and I later want to create mycoin, which can be converted to with either GOLD or VRSCTEST, I can create mycoin with:
